#Text=Justice GINSBURG , concurring in part and concurring in the judgment .
#Text=I join the Court 's opinion requiring a plaintiff who sues under 42 U.S.C. § 1981 to plead and prove race was a but - for cause of her injury .
#Text=In support of that holding , Comcast advances a narrow view of § 1981 's scope .

#Text=Section 1981 's guarantee of " the same right ... to make ... contracts , " Comcast urges , covers only the final decision whether to enter a contract , not earlier stages of the contract - formation process .

column1: #Text=Jones v. Alfred H. Mayer Co. , 392 U.S. 409 , 432 - 433 , 88 S.Ct . 2186 , 20 L.Ed.2d 1189 ( 1968 ) ( internal quotation marks omitted ; emphasis in original ) .
#Text=Under Comcast 's view , § 1981 countenances racial discrimination so long as it occurs in advance of the final contract - formation decision .
#Text=Thus , a lender would not violate § 1981 by requiring prospective borrowers to provide one reference letter if they are white and five if they are black .
#Text=Nor would an employer violate § 1981 by reimbursing expenses for white interviewees but requiring black applicants to pay their own way .
#Text=The employer could even " refus[e ] to consider applications " from black applicants at all .

column1: #Text=Brief for United States as   Amicus Curiae 21 .
#Text=That view can not be squared with the statute .
#Text=An equal " right ... to make ... contracts , " § 1981(a ) , is an empty promise without equal opportunities to present or receive offers and negotiate over terms .

#Text=A plaintiff hindered from enjoying those opportunities may be unable effectively to form a contract , and a defendant able to impair those opportunities can avoid contracting without refusing a contract outright .
#Text=It is implausible that a law " intended to ... secure ... practical freedom , "
#Text=Jones , 392 U.S. at 431 , 88 S.Ct . 2186 ( quoting Cong . Globe , 39th Cong . , 1st Sess . , 474 ( 1866 ) ) , would condone discriminatory barriers to contract formation .
#Text=Far from confining § 1981 's guarantee to discrete moments , the language of the statute covers the entirety of the contracting process .

#Text=The statute defines " make and enforce contracts " to " includ[e ] the making , performance , modification , and termination of contracts , and the enjoyment of all benefits , privileges , terms , and conditions of the contractual relationship . "

column1: #Text=So too the manner in which the contract is made .
#Text=The complaint before us contains allegations of racial harassment during contract formation .

#Text=In their negotiations , Entertainment Studios alleges , Comcast required of Entertainment Studios a series of tasks that served no purpose and on which Entertainment Studios " waste[d ] hundreds of thousands of dollars . "
#Text=App . to Pet . for Cert . 49a-50a .

#Text=The Court holds today that Entertainment Studios must plead and prove that race was the but - for cause of its injury - in other words , that Comcast would have acted differently if Entertainment Studios were not African - American owned .
#Text=But if race indeed accounts for Comcast 's conduct , Comcast should not escape liability for injuries inflicted during the contract - formation process .
#Text=The Court has reserved that issue for consideration on remand , enabling me to join its opinion .
